content:
this is a single endpoint from an open api spec document
it has been minified by removing unnecessary kvps
additionally common terms have been abbreviated  operationId: GetStacks path: https://gateway.stackpath.com/stack/v1/stacks content: params
name pagerequestfirst
desc the number of items desired
in query
required false
schema
type str
name pagerequestafter
desc the cursor value after which data will be returned
in query
required false
schema
type str
name pagerequestfilter
desc sqlstyle constraint filters
in query
required false
schema
type str
name pagerequestsortby
desc sort the response by the given field
in query
required false
schema
type str
name accountid
in query
required false
desc an account id
schema
type str
sum get all stacks
responses
200
stackgetstacksresponse
type obj
props
paginationpageinfo
type obj
props
totalcount
type str
desc the total number of items in the dataset
haspreviouspage
type bool
format bool
desc whether or not a previous page of data exists
hasnextpage
type bool
format bool
desc whether or not another page of data is available
startcursor
type str
desc the cursor for the first item in the set of data returned
endcursor
type str
desc the cursor for the last item in the set of data returned
desc information about a paginated response

this is modeled after the graphql relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination
results
type arr
stackstack
type obj
props
id
type str
desc a stacks unique identifier
accountid
type str
desc the id of the account that a stack belongs to
slug
type str
desc a stacks humanfriendly identifier

this can be used in place of a stacks id in most situations to identify a stack it can be no longer than 30 characters each being a lowercase letter number or dash it also cannot start with a dash end with a dash or have consecutive dashes this value can be provided on creation or is derived from the stacks name if a slug isnt provided this value cannot be updated once its created
name
type str
desc a stacks name

stack names cannot be empty cannot be over 255 characters long and must be unique per account
createdat
type str
format datetime
desc the date a stack was created
updatedat
type str
format datetime
desc the date a stack was last updated
deleteafter
type str
format datetime
desc the date that a stack will be processed for deletion

deletion is processed on or after this time stack deletion removes all services on the stack and cannot be halted once begun
stackstackstatus
type str
default pending
desc a stacks status

  pending the stack is being created
  active the stack is active and all active services on the stack are accessible
  disabled the stack and its services were disabled by the user
  suspended the stack and its services were suspended and are inaccessible
  billingsuspended the stack and its services were suspended by stackpath for billing reasons and are inaccessible
  deleted the stack and its services have been deleted and inaccessible
  deleterequested the stack has passed its deleteafter date and will be deleted
  deleteprocessing stack deletion has begun and cannot be interrupted
  suspendrequested stack suspension has been requested
  suspendprocessing stack suspension has started and services are being suspended
  unsuspendrequested stack unsuspension has been requested
  unsuspendprocessing stack unsuspension has begin and services are being reactivated
desc a stack
title: 29_Stacks_GetStacks_169.json
